page.title: 01KINGS NORTON LANDSCAPE
page.content: The northern part of our area straddles the southern boundary of the city of Birmingham and is suburban.The southern and much greater part is in Wythall and is rural.Kings Norton village,its old church and Victorian school is a conservation area.Since the 2nd.world war B'ham has built several municipal {housing} estates along the line of the main Redditch Road and BÂ£ham to Worcester Canal in the west.Bells Lane is the main east-west route also with municipal housing along it.The largest {shopping} centre is in the east at The Maypole,along the main road to Alcester.Parallel to this the Hollywood By-pass cuts south through the {farmlands} of Wythall.This rural area has remained unchanged for centuries.It is predominantly improved grassland for cattle and sheep.Written by children at Sir Theodore Pritchett Primary School.
